title: Parametric equations and particle motion - Part A

content.description: The position of a particle moving in the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaamyEaaaa@3AF7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-plane is given by the parametric function <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>p</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>y</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@490C@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mfrac> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>cos</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@510F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mfrac> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>sin</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@52AB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43ED@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds.
content.question:
Part A

Determine the time <math> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0baaaa@39F5@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and the position of the particle when the particle is farthest left.
